attributes.action: Make GI labels on foods in stores and restaurant menus a requirement
attributes.background: I suffer from Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome, as 1 in 8 women do across the country. The chronic illness that I have involves a symptom called Insulin Resistance which involves a very restrictive Low GI diet and exercise routine in order to keep manageable. The illness is linked with Type 2 diabetes.
attributes.additional_details: Last year alone, 3.7 million people in the UK were diagnosed with diabetes and it's estimated to rise to 5 million by 2025 if nothing changes. Food is our medicine when it comes to PCOS so I feel like the GI levels being printed on food will help lower the diabetes diagnosis rates in the UK. This is already a requirement in Austriallia: https://www.gisymbol.com/reading-food-labels/

attributes.action: Reinstate DLA for those with mental health or learning disabilities.
attributes.background: Personal Independence Payments criteria is frightfully ill-suited for those claimants that have a form of learning difficulty or mental health condition. The PIP criteria is dreadfully preposterous for this division of society. We are asking the government to reinstate DLA for these groups.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like the government to reconsider their options in regards to reinstating the Disability Living Allowance Criteria for this group of claimants. The following links back up the point of this petition.
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-fit-to-work-assessments-cost-more-than-they-save-report-reveals-a6801636.html
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-mental-health-discrimination-pip-cuts-mobility-mind-a7629866.html

attributes.action: Make 30 hours free child care available to all working parents including non-EU
attributes.background:
The conservative government introduced the 30 hours free child care to all working parents in 2016. This was a very welcomed news as it will help greatly with childcare costs.

I was greatly shocked to realise that we were NOT eligible for the 30hrs because of our immigration status(outside EEA).
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and my husband have been residents in this country for 9 years and we are both working, paying our taxes and NI. We are not entitled to public funds including child tax credit or child benefit.

It is UNFAIR that we get taxed as other working parents/ persons but we are denied the 30 hours free child care. This is harsh, unjust, unacceptable and discriminately. 


https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-brings-forward-plans-to-double-free-childcare-for-working-families

attributes.action: Make minimum wage and benefits the same regardless of age as it’s discrimination
attributes.background: It’s discriminatory for under 25s to get paid less for the same job as someone over 25. Also, if you’re single and under 35, you can only get Housing Benefit for bed-sit accommodation or a single room in shared accommodation.

attributes.action: Prohibit the sale and use of alcohol
attributes.background:
The UK Government cannot claim that cannabis deserves to be illegal while allowing the use of alcohol, which has continually been proven to cause far more damage than cannabis.

The UK remains the largest exporter of cannabis in the world while maintaining it has no medicinal value.
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol is directly responsible for an estimated cost to the NHS of £3.5 billion annually. 
Alcohol-related crime is estimated to cost between £8bn and £13bn per year.
In 2014-5, there were around 1.1 million hospital admissions related to alcohol consumption where an alcohol-related disease, injury or condition was the primary reason for admission.

This is clear evidence that alcohol is a harmful drug which can damage people’s mental and physical health, and harms individuals and communities.

attributes.action: Implement transitional employment for service leavers and veterans
attributes.background: Service leavers and veterans are currently discharged from service with no guarantee of transitional employment that would allow time for decompression of physical/mental health recovery. Service can be a long period of institutionalised pattern setting for veterans. There is a need for adjustment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/former-soldier-mp-says-veterans-12084010

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5426377/Freed-Royal-Marine-Alexander-Blackman-gets-new-job.html

Veterans make up 1 in 10 of the UK populous, we have upto 10000 in the HM prison service and 7,000 rough sleeping, about 170,000 working age veterans are unemployed or economically inactive with a veteran suicide every two weeks!

We need a significant change in support services!

attributes.action: Classify professional avoidable negligence as a criminal act
attributes.background: Of course mistakes happen, but too many are avoidable, and are classified as 'civil'. Many are not subject to criminal investigation, when sometimes this should be the case. 'Individuals' should also be held accountable. This would be a deterrent and lower the authority compensation liability.
attributes.additional_details: Professionals with a duty of care be it medical, social care, community or residential care that cause avoidable physical or mental harm, abuse, neglect or death through direct involvement and incorrect decision making, should be fully investigated through the justice system and the crown prosecution service and charged with criminal neglect. The logic is that it would encourage professionals to think twice and provide a strong deterrent when making hasty, rash and bias life changing decisions.

attributes.action: Cap the price of UK train fares so they are in line with other major economies
attributes.background: I ask the government to consider taking action against the astronomical train fares facing the British public. We pay significantly more than other major global economies. The train should be a cheaper alternative to driving for the sake of the environment and the future of the planet/mankind.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The Independent we spend "six times more on fares than peers in Europe with 14% of our income being spent on monthly season tickets...significantly higher than the 2% seen in France, 3% in Germany and 4% in Spain."

Fullfact.org says "the cost of an annual season ticket covering long-distance travel can exceed £3000, the equivalent of over £1000 more than the next dearest country: the Netherlands. "

attributes.action: Make ADHD part of the blue badge scheme
attributes.background: Autism and physical disabilities are included in the blue badge scheme but people don’t understand how hard it is to catch public transport and make your journey with an ADHD child!! When they have a set routine and you miss your bus ADHD is just a challenge as any other disability.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if ADHD children got accepted for a blue badge it would help a lot of families . Like less melt downs, less late trips or making shopping easier. Nothing is worse than having errands to do and your child is kicking off because you are 10 minutes late home and they have a certain routine.

attributes.action: Government needs to require harassment training for late night venue licenses
attributes.background: By training staff once a year, venues can ensure that staff know what to do and who to report to, ensuring women feel safe.This can be provided by existing trainers, and has been piloted in Southwark council. Training costs, which are low, could be covered by the venues.
attributes.additional_details: I work with women who experience abuse and see an increase in abuse to women especially in late night venues. Government needs to address the rising levels of sexual harassment that women experience in late night bars and clubs, by changing licensing laws to require landlords and venue owners to train staff on how to respond to sexual harassment complaints effectively.  A change in the law will ensure a clear message to those who harass others, and to those who just want the harassment to stop.

attributes.action: Revoke all Diplomatic and Economic ties with South Africa
attributes.background: Due to the actions of the current ANC leadership, I would like to see the same type of action taken as was put in place against the National Party in the 70’s and 80’s. The ANC needs to be put under pressure for the welfare of ALL South Africans.

attributes.action: Ban non 'diet' fizzy drinks having sweeteners in them
attributes.background:
Since the introduction of the sugar tax companies have been changing recipes for their standard drinks to reduce the amount of sugar by adding sweeteners.
For many people who either do not want to drink a 'diet' drink this has become very confusing and in most cases you cannot buy a drink without.
attributes.additional_details:
An example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). 
Or drinks labled 'Regular' or 'Classic' now contain sweetener although there are already no added sugar or diet versions.

The sugar tax has reduced a consumers choice so it is near impossible to buy a drink without sweeteners and it is already being shown that they cause as much a health risk as too much sugar. 
Moderation is the way forward not lack of choice.

attributes.action: Require free admission for more than one carer with a disabled client.
attributes.background: As a carer for disabled people it frustrates me when myself and other carers take disabled clients to attractions such as the zoo and are unable to get in as they only allow one carer in for free. A lot of individuals with additional needs have two carers for a reason, not just for show.
attributes.additional_details:
So why should the disabled client, that cannot work, have to pay for the second carer to get in when it's ok for one carer to get in for free. I feel like associations do not realise how much this impacts individuals with additional needs enjoying their lives as they cannot afford it. 
The human rights act 1998 states: 
Right of life 
Freedom of assembly and association 
Protection from discrimination 
Right to education 
 
So why is this a issue in disabled individuals lives on a day to day basis. The Government needs to intervene and make this a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Make chain stores responsible for their plastic packaging, i.e extreme fines
attributes.background:
In every shop you visit how many items are packaged in plastic? 

We need to make chain companies responsible for their plastic input to our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Goverment fines: 
• Super Stores/Markets
• Retail Stores
• Warehouses
• Fast food chains
• Delivery companies 
• etc
For the amount of plastic packaging and waste they produce, the UK should see a decline in plastic packaging; in turn this could lessen the companies fines. With the money that it produces this could go towards companies who break down plastics to recycle them, or in to making any plastic waste in to materials to make roads, for example, instead of using asphalt.

attributes.action: Lower the tax on alcohol sold in pubs and clubs
attributes.background: Once the local pub or club was the centre of a community, people met their future spouses, discussed their problems and received help, made friends and built a network of support encouraging a communal spirit and mental well-being. Cheap alcohol consumption from an off licence fosters non of this.
attributes.additional_details: There is a rising level of mental health issues / youth disorders I believe can be linked to the lose of community spirit. Clubs and pubs can form a focal point of this along side health and fitness centers, recreational clubs and community centers.  The tax on alcohol should be lowered in pubs / clubs to encourage people to get out and socialize rather than consume alcohol at home from off licence premises.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to upload ID when opening a new social media account
attributes.background: Uploading ID and proof of address when creating a new social media account in order to identify a person and to cut down on fake accounts and trolling. If we can identify who is behind a social media account maybe there wouldn’t be as much trolling.
attributes.additional_details: Social media has become very negative in the last 5 years and people of all ages feel pressured to be a certain way and to act happy even though deep down they could be in great pain. It is easy to put on a front to followers and people don’t feel they can talk to anybody about the way they are feeling because they have to come across a certain way to people they do not know.

attributes.action: Fund mental health facilities for Salisbury
attributes.background: There is a serious lack of mental health services and support in Salisbury. This particularly affects full time employed persons who need to pay for treatment because counselling is no longer available on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The closest counselling services available for face to face sessions are Melksham, Southampton and Andover. For full time employees, receiving time off work is very difficult. There’s also the cost of paying for travel on top of the sessions. There are regular suicides in our city and people are crying out for some kind of regular service. Services should include DBT and more in depth CBT therapies and classes.

attributes.action: Ban the sale, manufacture or distribution of plastic confetti in the UK.
attributes.background: Plastic confetti is still used at weddings and parties despite it being a dramatic example of littering non-biodegradable materials.  Confetti is designed to be small and light to 'float' when thrown and therefore it is very hard to pick up and will spread widely in the wind. It has to go!
attributes.additional_details: Today I saw Branscombe Beach on Devon covered in silver and gold confetti.  There was so much it was impossible to collect it all and it was very hard to pick up as it was so thin and small.  This kind of littering has to stop and individuals celebrating need to be prevented from making environmentally damaging choices such as this. When so many other options are available,  plastic confetti needs up be banned.

attributes.action: Remove the Home Office exemption from the Data Protection Act
attributes.background: The Home Office has been given an exemption from GDPR and the data protection Act 2018. Citizens have a right to know what is being discussed with regard to their cases and an exemption puts us at risk of more scandals such as windrush.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens should not be denied the right to their data and further exclusions from society.

attributes.action: Create a Memorial Day for all killed working in emergency services
attributes.background: Many people in the emergency services sadly lose their lives while carrying out their duty. We should create a day to remember them, separate from Remembrance Sunday and other memorial days.

attributes.action: We would like the livestock act 1953 to be amended to include alpaca and llama.
attributes.background: Our Alpaca boys were attacked by two lurchers, leaving them traumatised & having to re-home. No prosecution was possible as  the dogs do not fall under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991, and llamas and alpacas are not protected by the Dogs (Protection of Livestock) Act 1953.
attributes.additional_details: We think this act should be amended to protect these animals.

attributes.action: Ban building on all greenfield sites.
attributes.background: Builders should only be allowed to build on brownfield sites including over railways, supermarkets, derelict sites. The UK needs to protect all remaining greenfield for food safety and clean air.

attributes.action: Make gender-neutral passports available for British citizens
attributes.background: The UK government currently allows only 'M'/'F' gender markers on travel documents, which effectively erases many non-binary and intersex people. I would urge the government to recognise these already marginalised groups.
attributes.additional_details:
In a recent dispute the high court was told gender-neutral passports would affect legislation, be prohibitively expensive and increase the need for consular support for British citizens.

None of which negates the fact that we still need them, whatever the cost, and that if legislation doesn't account for non-binary and intersex people, it badly needs revising.
 
Gender-neutral passports are already recognised internationally. Ten countries currently offer a third gender option, 'X', or unknown.

attributes.action: Devolve TV Broadcasting to Scottish Government Arts, Culture & Sport Ministry
attributes.background: British broadcasters have neglected their obligation to the people of Scotland, leaving it comparatively invisible in the networks,as there is a "huge accountability-gap" in Scotland as UK Government responsibility lies at Westminster instead of Scottish Government as it is with N. Ireland
attributes.additional_details:
We need to trust our politicians and institutions, devolvement  of television broadcasting would assist the need for transparency and responsibility for localised accountability within Scotland assuring a fairer and more balanced reporting in Scotland and the promotion of the Gaelic Language to Scots. 
At present, Scotland has the lowest proportion of TV Licence Fee to programming collecting £350 million with £89 million set aside for operating costs in Scotland leaving £281 million to go out.

attributes.action: Allow individuals with  Coeliac Disease to join the British Armed Forces
attributes.background: Currently you cannot join any British Armed Forces with Coeliac Disease as it may affect operational ability. Vegetarian/ Halal diets are provided- but no GF. Coeliacs can be asymptomatic and with a GF diet would be an asset to the Armed Forces. Refusal to supply a Gluten Free diet is discriminatory
attributes.additional_details:
The Israeli Army has started supplying Gluten Free diets to it's soldiers proving it possible.Refusal to provide a GF catering option in the UK  Forces is discriminatory. Coeliac sufferers  should be assessed on an individual basis when applying to enlist. There is an undisclosed number of serving personnel,diagnosed following enlistment - some required early discharge 
/ medical downgrading - but many who continue active service. Exact numbers unknown as previous FOI requests were rejected

attributes.action: Cut National Citizens Service funding and apply funds to schools and the NHS
attributes.background: In 2017 NCS recieved £180.5 million from the government and has proceeded to spend it on extravagant advertisements instead of the actual service. This money could be better used by schools which constantly face budget cuts and the NHS which is in desperate need of more funding.

attributes.action: Let women set a cap on how much they will claim from the father of their child
attributes.background: The law disregards agreements made by women who conceive via sperm donation without using a clinic. This puts men who help them at risk of getting a huge bill. Many are deterred; among them those who could bring most to the self-image, aspirations and aptitudes of the children.
attributes.additional_details:
A legally recognised ‘limit of liability’ would give security to the donor while allowing scope for some agreed financial contribution. This could:

avoid the need for secrecy and anonymity

provide more money for poorer families

make sperm donation a practical alternative to getting pregnant in an unsatisfactory or short-term relationship

start a virtuous circle of better donors and higher regard for sperm donation

For comments, questions and discussion please go to:

limitofliability.blogspot.co.uk

attributes.action: Raise Awarness for Morgellons Disease and co infections eg: Lymes Disease
attributes.background: I was bitten by a tick in the uk in 2011 I didn’t seek treatment as I didn’t no the risks. I was very ill over a number of years losing my hair etc. It was only when fibres started to come from my skin that I was diagnosed with Morgellons Disease a chronic form of Lymes Disease caused by the tick
attributes.additional_details: I am now under treatment but can’t be cured. Yet this Disease is still not recognised as a genuine illness as over the years patients have been dismissed as being dillusional. I am under a Dermatologist at the Royal London Hospital. Who states this is not a dillusion! The Disease needs listing on the rare disease register

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic film wrappers that are not biodegradable.
attributes.background: Many plastic film wrappers such as those used when mailing magazines, are not biodegradable. Yet materials that could replace such wrappers are readily available. The existing wrappers cause, at the very least, an eye-sore when blown around our countryside. At the extreme they kill wild creatures.

attributes.action: Make interest on student loan repayments tax deductible.
attributes.background: Currently, the interest we pay on student loans is not tax deductible. Every year, 6.1% interest is charged on our student loan balance. Assuming we finish university £40,000 in debt, we have £2,440 a year of interest payments to make before we are even able to reduce our principal balance.
attributes.additional_details: Under the current system, you would have to earn about £52,111 just to be able to pay every year the interest on your balance (assuming you have £40,000 debt). The government then charges you 40% tax on your interest payment, costing you £976 a year. Assuming you earn £52,111; you are paying the government £3,416 (976+2440) a year for borrowing their money (without decreasing your balance). Corporation have tax-deduction on their interest payments, so should students.

attributes.action: Make bullying awareness part of the national curriculum in all schools.
attributes.background: I feel too many children are suffering from bullying on a daily basis, and not enough action is being done. Yes schools have posters about zero tolerance on bullying, but how many kids actually pay attention. I feel a minimum of 30 minutes a week classroom time will make children more aware.
attributes.additional_details: I have never struggled with bullying personally, but after reading a heart breaking story of a young boy, who sadly took his own life due to bullying, I feel it is time to integrate bullying awareness into children's lives, and the ideal place for this to take place is in the classroom, across all ages and all schools. I strongly believe a bullying awareness curriculum in schools could lower this stigma and ideally save lives.

attributes.action: Legalise bow hunting in the UK
attributes.background:
I am petitioning as a fellow bowman to relegalise bow hunting. It has been a skillful way of supplying meat since the ancient times.

But now, in the UK, it is all done by guns, and bows are no longer legal. There is neither any explanation as to why it is illegalised. But we can change that.
attributes.additional_details:
The difference between guns and bows are as follows;
Bullets can get lost in your game, only to be found painfully when eating the game - Arrows get taken out soon after game is caught.
Guns are loud, scaring the animal before it dies - Bows are not as loud, if without silencers, still allowing a more humane hunt.
Gun fumes and bullet/shell remains are pollutable - Arrows are collected if found.
Bows are lighter but more convenient to that of loading a gun, which emmits noise.

attributes.action: Make creative writing an A level subject again.
attributes.background:
Creative writing should be an A level subject as it is just as difficult as any others. For young people who want to become writers , their options at A level limit them.
Creative writing A level is fun and a way to get young people’s imaginations sparked in today’s society.

attributes.action: Stop animals being given away as prizes or sold at funfairs.
attributes.background: Carnival fish are often kept in poor conditions in small bags. These bags become very hot on warm days and will run out of oxygen. They're given without any advice on how to care for them. Goldfish live on average 5-10 years in captivity however carnival fish often die shortly after being given.

attributes.action: Demand President Trump pays for the extra security of his visit, and not the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is to provide upgraded security for the visit of Donald Trump. This visit is unwanted by the citizens of the UK, due to the actions of the president and the united states government under his control. We there for demand the united states pays the additional costs and not our tax payers.

attributes.action: Remove GDPR from UK law as soon as we leave the EU in March 2019.
attributes.background: GDPR has probably been the worst piece of red tape to come out of the EU, its extremely costly to businesses, mainly to small businesses who don’t have massive legal departments and staff in place to swallow up the regulation. GDPR is also extremely damaging to our economy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK voted to leave the EU 2 years ago and we are still having to put up with the ridiculously damaging and annoying regulations. It is believed that the cost of GDPR to UK businesses has already run into the billions, with many small business not at all geared up to deal with it.

attributes.action: Urge the Indian Government to investigate and prevent Sterlite pollution
attributes.background: British company Vedanta Sterlite Copper begun construction of a new 4 million tonne/year smelter, almost doubling capacity. The existing smelter is believed to have continuously polluted the water and air since 1996, causing respiratory, dermal infections and other illness, particularly in children.
attributes.additional_details:
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/10-killed-as-cops-fire-on-anti-sterlite-protesters-in-tuticorin/articleshow/64279479.cms 
The Env Impact Assessment is believed to be a sham. Coastal regulations forbidding the location of industrial plant within 25km of the Gulf of Mannar biosphere reserve were ignored. Reports of illegal waste dumps and port data reveal the use of highly contaminated copper concentrates and indicate that waste has been disposed of in the Gulf of Mannar.

attributes.action: The immediate expulsion of all Israeli diplomats and sanctions against Israel.
attributes.background: The atrocities taking place in Gaza needs to be brought to the attention of the government. Israel needs to be held accountable for its actions against innocent people.

attributes.action: UK public to vote on any military action
attributes.background: The UK government get involved in military action again and yet no member of the UK public voted or have any choice if they use our tax pounds to pay for it or indeed even to get involved. #notinmyname

attributes.action: Reduce knife and gun crime with deterrent sentences
attributes.background:
10 yrs minimum for carrying a knife 
20 yrs minimum for using a knife 

20yrs minimum for carrying a gun
40yrs minimum for using a gun

All without parole.
attributes.additional_details:
The current sentences that the judiciary are handing out are obviously not deterrent enough

Act now !

Save lives !

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS' National Child Measurement Programme for children in Year 6
attributes.background: Parents are told their child’s overweight if they're on the 91st centile (14% of Yr 6), but many are healthy. In a vulnerable child, this label can lead to eating disorders and THEN they become unhealthy. The scheme isn't working; child obesity at this age has continued to rise since it began.
attributes.additional_details: This NHS scheme hasn't lowered obesity rates, but much needed funding is spent on this ineffective scheme, as well as support for eating disorders that could have been triggered by it. Schools often feed children unhealthy meals but then weigh them and they are are obese. Eating disorders at this age are highly damaging as they delay puberty; children can't develop and grow, and mental well-being is drastically affected. This happened to me 2 years ago, age 11, when I was deemed 'overweight'.

attributes.action: Make guide dogs available as part of the mobility scheme, not reliant on charity
attributes.background: There is nothing more curtailing of your independence and mobility than sight loss, funds should be available via the mobility scheme to train a guide dog rather than people being reliant on charitable funds.

attributes.action: Don't ban pet shops from being able to sell puppies and kittens.
attributes.background: The wrong people will be punished along with the innocent. Pet shops have licenses to sell them. Also what will happen to these poor animals now pet shops will not be able to take them in.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people convicted of murder.
attributes.background: People convicted of murder should face the death penalty.

attributes.action: Request for help and assist for serious flood situation Kerala, India,
attributes.background: This petition on behalf of Malayalies in UK and their families and friends in Kerala included among the 35 Million, the southern state of India. Death toll is rising every hour, every minute. More than 250,000 people have fled their homes.The aged, young, ill and pregnant are stranded.
attributes.additional_details:
All the shutters of 36 of the 39 reservoirs have been open and it was continuously and heavily raining for the past one week.

We beg for mercy in front of the whole world, we need help

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-45216671

https://www.facebook.com/johnygeorge.kalathiparambil/videos/1830622453700580/UzpfSTEwMDAwNTE3MDcxNDIwNDoxMDY3Nzk3ODk2NzM1ODkx/
https://news.sky.com/world
https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/17/asia/kerala-flood-death-rise-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Make Escort Vehicles Carry Highways Agency Code Of Practice Mandatory.
attributes.background:
I would like the Highways Agency Code of Practice for Escort Vehicles markings and lighting made mandatory.
I am increasingly observing so called Escort Vehicles without adequate safety warning markings front or rear including width of vehicle lighting.
I doubt they are fully insured or equipped.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am describing does not make a good Escort Operator but does bring a more safety conscious driver to the mind of the motoring public therefore safety becomes more paramount. If you like, wearing a uniform describes our profession at a glance. 
There are many of us who adhere to this practice including the equipment we should be carrying for emergency or breakdown and can be found on social media where we share some experiences.

attributes.action: Make local Authorities pay for injuries caused by neglect of public path/roads
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that local authorities pay compensation/vet fees for anyone/thing that is injuried due to them not maintaining public footpaths/roads/footbridges correctly.
attributes.additional_details: My dog had two claws ripped out from the root due to the local authorities neglect by not maintaining public footbridges correctly. The bridge had been covered by metal sheeting on top of rotten boards, over time and use the metal sheeting has come loose and moved resulting in my dogs claws becoming traped between levels resulting in two claws being ripped out. The local authority failed to compensate/pay vet fees even tho they carried out urgent repair work. Why should we and our pets suffer.

attributes.action: An additional £350 million/week must go to the NHS or hold a second referendum
attributes.background: The UK was made to believe that an additional £350 million per week would go to the NHS due to savings directly caused by leaving the EU. If this does not happen the country was lied to by politicians & the vote is therefore invalid. A second Brexit referendum must be held based on detailed facts.

attributes.action: Mandate a 50% reduction in all rail fares until normal service is resumed.
attributes.background: The new timetable introduced on 20/05/18 led to massive disruption to journeys. It is the passenger's responsibility to claim delay repay. It would be fairer for all concerned if the ticket price was reduced by 50% until 95% of timetabled services arrived within one minute of the scheduled time

attributes.action: Bring AS exams back and rid of A Level exams for the sake of youth mental health
attributes.background: AS exams have been dwindled away due to Michael Gove’s, former education secretary, reforms to A-Level exams. Previously, students would learn a years worth of content and then take the exam, now majority of exams are taken after the 2 year course. A Level exams are also getting harder
attributes.additional_details:
This pressure and strain leads to mental health issues such as anxiety, panic, emotional distress and depression to name a few. The calls mental health organizations receive have been increasing significantly over the years, leaving some dropping out of sixth form altogether in hand reducing teenagers motivation

To say these issues can be eradicated by ridding of the linear style would be inaccurate but it can surely reduce it and make the A-Level process much easier and more controllable.
